appsgate.lig.logical.object.spec
Interface AbstractObjectSpec

All Known Implementing Classes:
AVTransportProxyImpl, ConnectionManagerProxyImpl, ContactSensorImpl, ContentDirectoryProxyImpl, KeyCardSensorImpl, LuminositySensorImpl, OnOffAcuatorImpl, RenderingControlProxyImpl, SwitchSensorImpl, TemperatureSensorImpl, UndefinedSensorImpl
public interface AbstractObjectSpec

This java interface is an ApAM specification shared by all ApAM AppsGate specification to share the AbstractObjectSpec java interface.

Since:
February 13, 2013
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Cédric Gérard

Method Detail

getAbstractObjectId

java.lang.String getAbstractObjectId()
This generic method allow caller to get the object id, whatever the real object type.

Returns:
the real object identifier

getUserObjectName

java.lang.String getUserObjectName()
This method allow caller to get the name set by the user, whatever the object type.

Returns:
the current user name

getLocationId

int getLocationId()
This method allow the caller to get the location id of the current place where it was installed.

Returns:
the identifier of the corresponding place

getUserType

java.lang.String getUserType()
This method allow the caller to get a user friendly description of the object type.

Returns:
the user friendly type

getObjectStatus

int getObjectStatus()
This method allow the caller to get the current object status. Status values: 0 = Off line or out of range 1 = In validation mode (test range for sensor for instance) 2 = In line or connected

Returns:
an integer that represent the current status

getPictureId

java.lang.String getPictureId()
This method allow the caller to get the current picture of this object.

Returns:
the id of the corresponding picture
